To take this a step further, I like to visualise the condensation beginning in lots of small droplets, which symbolises **MEETING**, then those droplets all trickle away to something bigger, a puddle, which symbolises **SOCIETY**.

M2 **PARTICLE OF NOMINALIZATION**: A noun is a fundamental **part** of a sentence, as oppose to adjectives or verbs which act upon nouns; Nouns give the sentence a **PLACE** on which the sentence can pivot. For this we could do right modifies left.

mems.text: See the right grapheme as an altar/table with a wand-like instrument on top (i.e. that stroke that comes off at the top right of it). This is the "naming table"; we use the wand to assign a name to things; the _bundle of rice_ to the left just happens to be the thing we're assigning a name to; **APPELLATION**.

mems.author: Big_Bob
mems.text: A way to instantly realise this kanji pertains to phonetics is to see the _bow_ firing the wand like an arrow from the _naming table_. To resolve the phonetics, realise arrow is **YA**, and that you need to look where to fire the arrow; look/regard is **MI**.
